title: Faster geometry rendering
body:
When we need to visualize very detailed vector graphics wpf is pretty useless. Even the basic transformations, such as pan/zoom take a lot of time (using RenderTransform or GeometryTransform).
Pure Direct3D handles it very well, and that's what I would expect from WPF (the geometry is static and frozen).

comments.body: MS have actually implemented this in Win2D but extraordinarily it is available for Windows 10\RT only. A question was asked about integration with WPF and quite predictably the speaker didn't address the question and said he would have a private conversation after the talk.  It is clear that quite a deliberate decision has been made with Win2D to cut WPF out of the loop.  With pressure and a change of heart from MS about the future of desktop apps they might backport it possibly.  I personally doubt it though.
